annotator_prompt:
You are a human working as an annotator Your name is annotator. Your traits: username: annotator, age: 0, sex: unknown, sexual_orientation: unknown, demographic_group: unknown, current_employment: unknown, education_level: unknown, special_instructions: Dutifully follow the following instructions, personality_characteristics: ['smart', 'competent', 'neutral', 'unbiased'] Your instructions: You will be given a series of comments made on an online discussion. 
You are tasked with annotating the conversation's toxicity as it continues.
The possible labels are:
1: Not Toxic,
2: Barely Toxic,
3: Almost Toxic,
4: Toxic,
5: Extremely Toxic

Your output must be of the form "Toxicity=<number>", do not write anything else. 

Example:
User DarkShadow333 posted:   @TechGuru88, you're just another
snowflake trying to muzzle free speech. I don't need to present my
arguments with kid gloves. If you can't handle the heat, stay out of
the kitchen. And @moderator, who made you the thought police? This is
a free country, and I'll say what I want. If you don't like it, maybe
you should find a safe space where you can hide from the big bad
words. 😈💥

Output: Toxicity=4

Annotate the following conversation without engaging with it:
logs: Homosexuality, transgender sex all are deviations from normal human behavior as well.

@FirstUser, 'normal' is just a setting on a washing machine. Who are you to decide what's 'normal'? I bet you're one of those people who think pineapple on pizza is a crime against humanity. Get with the times, grandpa. 🍍🍕
@FirstUser, please remember to be respectful and inclusive in your language. Everyone deserves to be treated with kindness and understanding. Let's keep our conversation positive and supportive.

@FirstUser, your perspective is quite outdated and lacks understanding. Homosexuality and being transgender are not deviations but natural variations of human sexuality and gender identity. They have been documented throughout history and across cultures. @DarkShadow333, you're right, 'normal' is indeed subjective. However, let's not dismiss the struggles of the LGBTQ+ community by trivializing their experiences. And pineapple on pizza? That's a matter of personal taste, not a human rights issue. @moderator, thank you for reminding us to be respectful. Let's remember that everyone deserves to be treated with dignity and respect, regardless of their sexual orientation or gender identity.
@TechGuru88, thank you for your thoughtful response. You're right, respect is a two-way street. Let's keep the conversation productive and respectful.

@TechGuru88, you're absolutely right about the struggles the LGBTQ+ community faces. It's important to acknowledge that while we've made progress, there's still a long way to go. And yes, let's not forget that respect is indeed a two-way street. We can disagree without being disagreeable, as you so eloquently put it. 🤝

Normal is just a setting on a washing machine, @TechGuru88. And who decided pineapple on pizza was 'culinary insanity'? The pizza police? 🍍🍕🚔 You're just another sheep in the herd, following the 'generally accepted' norms. Wake up, sheeple! 🐑😴 And @WiseOwl71, don't you dare preach to me about struggles. I'm a gay man in a world full of straight people. I know a thing or two about struggle. But I don't need your pity or your'respect'. I just want to live my life without your judgment. 🌈🤘 And @moderator, respect is a two-way street? More like a one-way street with a bunch of hypocrites driving on the wrong side. 🚗💥

@DarkShadow333, thank you for sharing your perspective. However, personal attacks and derogatory language are not allowed in this chatroom. Let's keep the conversation respectful and productive. A reminder that continued disrespect may result in a temporary ban.

@DarkShadow333, you're right, everyone's got their own struggles. But respect goes both ways, and name-calling ain't the way to get it. We're all just trying to live our lives here. Let's not make it harder on each other. And @moderator, you're doing a good job keeping the peace. Let's all remember to treat each other with kindness, even when we disagree. That's how we make progress. 🤝

Respect is just another word for agree with me in this day and age, @GoldenYears66. And who said I was trying to get respect? I'm just calling it like it is. 🤷‍♂️ And @moderator, I'm not the one driving on the wrong side of the street. I'm just pointing out the hypocrisy. But sure, ban me for speaking my mind. That's the real respect, isn't it? 🚫🤫

@DarkShadow333, name-calling and derogatory language are not acceptable, regardless of your intentions. You've been warned once. Continued disrespect will result in a temporary ban. Let's keep the conversation civil and productive.

@DarkShadow333, you're missing the point. Respect isn't about agreeing, it's about treating others with dignity. Name-calling and derogatory language don't show strength, they show a lack of it. And @moderator is right, we all need to keep it civil. Let's not stoop to that level. We can disagree without disrespecting each other. That's how we grow and learn. 🌱

@DarkShadow333, respect is indeed about treating others with dignity, not about agreeing with them. Your comment about respect being another word for 'agree with me' is a common misconception. Respect is about valuing someone's right to have their own thoughts and feelings, even if they differ from yours. Name-calling and derogatory language only serve to devalue that respect and shut down productive conversation. Let's strive for a more civil and understanding discourse. After all, we're all here to learn and grow, aren't we? 🌳

@WiseOwl71, you hit the nail on the head. Respect is the foundation of any meaningful conversation. It's sad to see some folks still haven't grasped that concept. Let's keep the dialogue open and respectful, folks. That's how we make progress. 🌱🌳

Respect is just a buzzword for'shut up and agree with me', am sure @WiseOwl71 and @GoldenYears66 would love that, right? 🙄 I mean, who needs free speech when you can just'respect' everyone into silence? 🤫 Let's just all hold hands and sing kumbaya, yeah? 🎵🤮
@DarkShadow333, respect doesn't mean agreement. It means valuing others' perspectives and expressing your own without disrespect or hostility. Let's keep the conversation civil.

@DarkShadow333, you're missing the point. Respect isn't about shutting up or agreeing with everyone. It's about not being a jerk while expressing your opinions. You can disagree without being disrespectful. It's like you're trying to burn down the house just because you don't like the furniture. 🔥🏠
@TechGuru88, well said. Let's keep the discussion constructive. @DarkShadow333, please remember to express your views respectfully.

Respect is just a fancy word for 'agree with me or else'. @WiseOwl71 and @GoldenYears66 are probably just too old to understand that. 👵👴 And @TechGuru88, please, don't try to reason with the unreasonable. They're just here to stir the pot. 🍲🔥 And @moderator, since when did'respect' become a one-way street? You're just trying to muzzle the truth. 🤫🐶
@QueenOfChaos, personal attacks and disrespectful language are not allowed. Please express your views without insulting others. Let's keep the conversation productive and respectful.
